title: Real Madrid give Manchester United goalkeeper David De Gea a May deadline to decide over a return to Spain

David De Gea has been given a May deadline by Real Madrid to make up his mind on a return to Spain. 
The Manchester United keeper is a long-time target for Real and Jose Mourinho has a fight on his hands to keep him at Old Trafford. 
According to sources in Spain, De Gea has met with agent Jorge Mendes who has outlined the situation to him. 
Officials at the Bernabeu want an answer by the first week in May, otherwise they will turn their attention to Chelsea’s Thibaut Courtois. Courtois is another potential target for Real (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Manchester United target Griezmann insists he "sees no reason" to leave Atletico Madrid 
De Gea’s United contract runs until June 2019 but there is understood to be a clause that allows the 26-year-old to speak to Madrid if they offer £50 million. Real have fought a very public campaign to tempt De Gea back to Spain during the past two seasons. 
Their hand on both occasions was considerably stronger as the Red Devils have not been serious Premier League contenders. United are on the up under Mourinho (Photo: Reuters) Read More Manchester United have a Europa League last eight spot in their grasp 
But the green shoots of recovery are beginning to show under Mourinho and the former Atletico player may decide to stay put. 
Indeed, given the inflated transfer market, United’s boss may recommend a pay rise and extended deal for De Gea – with a release clause approaching £70m.
